website_summaries.verdict: If you need extra protection against moisture, this is the best option.
pros: The waterproof membrane is true to its name, and these hiking boots don't need to be broken in for a comfortable fit
The thinner soles are flexible while still offering protection
cons: These boots run narrow and may be uncomfortable for some

customer_reviews.title: I'm extremely pleased with the comfort of these lightweight hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots were comfortable and ready for extended wear straight out of the box without any "break in" period necessary. I would have to say they are every bit as comfortable as my gym shoes. SIZING I wear anywhere from a size 10 to a 10.5 US in most brands. I purchased these in a size 10, because my winter pair of Asolo's is a 10.5 and I wear really thick socks with them. I plan on using this new pair as my warm weather hiking boots with thinner socks, and the fit is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Good Boot but break-in time needed.
customer_reviews.text: Need some breakin time for this boot. Not like some of the Asolo boots I owned in the past where not much breakin time was needed. Feel confident in hiking in these boots with the great grip and feel for the terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Glomb

customer_reviews.title: a comfortable lightweight boot
customer_reviews.text: protective around the toes, while feeling like a high top tennis shoe, the soles are stiff enough to step on rocks and soft enough to feel them. I took these shoes on a 13 mile hike the first time I wore them and they did give me a small blister on my right heel, I think that after I get used to them they will be one of my favorite boots ever.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan A. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, previously had a pair of A solo boots ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, previously had a pair of A solo boots for years finally wore them out. As far as boots go Asolo is a favorite for me.
customer_reviews.author: owen lindley

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boot. Fits true to size. Very light weight yet rugged and durable. It has very good ankle support. The soles have very good traction. Best of all they are very comfortable to wear. I can hike all day in these boots and my feet are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Peter DiFilippo

customer_reviews.title: Light weight hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Took these straight to pacific northwest and did a week of 15-20 miles days on steep trails. Required zero break in. Felt great. Light weight hiking boot.
customer_reviews.author: lhm

customer_reviews.title: new favorite
customer_reviews.text: Put these boots on straight out of the box and went on a five mile hike. They felt like an old friend on my feet. I've been through many pairs of hiking boots in my 58 years but these are my new all time favorites.
customer_reviews.author: bal

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Read some reviews about the size feeling too small and order it 1/2 size larger. It fit perfect and feel very comfortable. Good quality construction and nice looking boots.
customer_reviews.author: Caribbean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Hiking Boots
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this style of boot from Asolo, and now I have a waterproof pair, life couldn't be better. I have my first backpacking trip coming up in these in a few days, so I'll get to see how they perform in the field. But even if you don't wear them for outdoors activities, they are extremely comfortable and perfect for every day wear.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Buffington

customer_reviews.title: Asolos work for me
customer_reviews.text: As I noted in a review of the Asolo Quadrant, the Asolo anatomical foot bed works very well for my feet. The heels are a bit narrow and the toeboxes are nice and roomy. The anatomical footbed seems to cradle the foot in such a way that extra cushioning is unnecessary. My only issue with the Restons is that I normally double tie boot laces and these are too short to do so. I have ordered longer laces from the Asolo website as a result. I have four different Asolo styles and am definitely a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Kept my feet dry during heavy rain and had good traction on
customer_reviews.text: Fit well once broken in but not much heel support. Had to use Dr. Scholl's plantar faciitas pads to prevent feet from hurting. Kept my feet dry during heavy rain and had good traction on rocks
customer_reviews.author: Don Cleary

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 size smaller than normal
customer_reviews.text: Just order 1/2 size larger like everyone else says and they fit and feel great. I use for everyday wear.
customer_reviews.author: Hulk Pro

customer_reviews.title: Great boots with lighter socks
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable light hiking boots. These aren't for snowy winter hikes, but are great for 3-season hikes. Feels like they fit about a half-size small -- they're snug across the top of the toe box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer in Texas

customer_reviews.title: great shoes. Very nice arch support
customer_reviews.text: Overall, great shoes. Very nice arch support. If they were a little wider, they would be perfect. The soles are great, not too chunky and you can feel the ground contours when hiking.
customer_reviews.author: walt

customer_reviews.title: comfortable. All you need to know about a great
customer_reviews.text: Durable, waterproof, comfortable. All you need to know about a great product
customer_reviews.author: Trevor J Powhida

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome! Did the lost coast trail in CA which ...
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! Did the lost coast trail in CA which covers nearly every terrain. They held up beautifully and came away with 0 blisters over 26 miles. Love the way the look too. Recommended you break them in for 2-3 miles as the sole insert does need to form to your foot.
customer_reviews.author: John J Foster

customer_reviews.title: Then I am good to go
customer_reviews.text: I always replace the stock liners with Superfeet. Then I am good to go. These boots (the brand) fit met like no other and the sizing is very consistent. Love 'em!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Ames

customer_reviews.title: ... that are as rugged as a truck but rides like a sports car
customer_reviews.text: Boots that are as rugged as a truck but rides like a sports car.
customer_reviews.author: LeMans

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: A great boot. Straight out of the box I hiked 17 miles(including a mountain climb) and my feet felt great. The extra room for your toes feels very good after hours of hiking/climbing.
customer_reviews.author: KNOOP

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love them water proof look nice and you want see (almost ) any body wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Karim B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits great and took virtually no time to break them in!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan D Upton

customer_reviews.title: Quality of materials is very good!, the vibram sole is also harder than ...
customer_reviews.text: It fit as expected but using thin socks, they are somewhat small when using thick socks for trecking. The inside sole or insole is very stiff, almost no cushion. I change the insole for a softer one and they turn more confortable. Quality of materials is very good!, the vibram sole is also harder than other vibram shoes like Merrell. It is a good pair of boots but a little stiff at the sole and insidesole.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Nieto

customer_reviews.title: Best boot I've worn
customer_reviews.text: Put 105 miles on these in 7 days on the John Muir Trail.. the most comfortable boots I've ever worn. True to size, good toe box, super comfortable and airy. Note that I do always replace the insole with Superfeet or Powerstep insoles.
customer_reviews.author: K. Adler

customer_reviews.title: Best Day Hike boots I have owned
customer_reviews.text: These boots are lightweight and fit extremely well for me. I have only used them once on about a five mile hike, but highly recommend them. I had only worn them a little around the house prior to the hike, so it doesn't take much to "break them in".
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn Knight

customer_reviews.title: Boot too narrow?
customer_reviews.text: I am getting red marks on my pinky toe and am thinking my feet are too wide for this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: IT-Spec

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good fit, returned due to lack of cushion in sole.
customer_reviews.author: ribbon mike

customer_reviews.title: A Hikers Boot
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Excellent finish. Cons: Stiff insole (can be taken care of by a good breaking in and swapping the insoles).
customer_reviews.author: NonfictionCalifornia

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and light
customer_reviews.text: Make a short cruise and excellent feel, I try to kick a damp environment to check its impermeability. They are very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Tiscornia

customer_reviews.title: Hard, stiff and narrow
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed when I tried these on. I was really excited to get some nice multi-weather hiking shoes. I should have learned by now never to buy shoes online I have never tried on before. They were really stiff and had narrow soles, I felt like I was walking on stilts. Returned them right away. Everyone's feet fit shoes differently. I have a very normal size/width men's size 10 foot. It may be exactly what some people want in a shoe, just not me. Too bad, they looked really cool. I guess i'll go to the store and get a different pair.
customer_reviews.author: R+SFly

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: Love the fit and toughness of this boot. Wore it out in the Utah dessert for several months of work. Held up great and kept my feet in good shape. Still looks good and wear it often.
customer_reviews.author: Chris N

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I own
customer_reviews.text: I have about 450 miles on these bad boys and they're still holding strong . I only wear these on the trail and for camping. Also use them as snow boots and they are perfect in every way.
customer_reviews.author: dylan leal

product_meta.title: Asolo Mens Reston WP
product_meta.description: FEATURES of the Asolo Men's Reston Waterproof Boot Upper: Water-resistant suede mm 1,6-1,8 polyester Lining: Waterproof Anatomic Footbed: Natural Shape Sole: Asolo/Vibram Natural Shape (rubber-eva) Fit: MM Weight: 1/2 pair: 445 grams
